summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from December 3, 2019, regarding a press inquiry from a Norwegian journalist about the FBI's interest in speaking with a Norwegian individual (name redacted) who traveled on Jeffrey Epstein's private jet. The FBI case team initially states no awareness of a connection to Norway, but the inquiry is forwarded to the FBI's Legal Attaché in Copenhagen for follow-up.

persons.name: Runa Fjellanger
persons.context: Journalist for VG, Norway's biggest newspaper, who sent an inquiry to the FBI's National Press Office asking about the FBI's interest in a Norwegian individual connected to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Norwegian Press Inquiry to FBI
events.description: Journalist Runa Fjellanger emails the FBI's National Press Office with questions about the FBI's reported interest in speaking with a Norwegian individual who traveled on Jeffrey Epstein's private jet.

keyFacts: A Norwegian journalist inquired if the FBI wanted to speak with a specific Norwegian individual who reportedly traveled on Jeffrey Epstein's private jet several times.
The FBI's internal response indicates the case team was initially unaware of any connection to Norway regarding the Epstein investigation.
The inquiry was forwarded to the FBI's Legal Attaché (Legat) in Copenhagen for potential engagement with law enforcement in Norway.
The journalist's questions also referenced potential FBI interest in Crown Princess Mette-Marit of Norway, though the FBI's response does not address this.
